usefulItems: frying pan (19 cm), bowl, sieve, paper towel, serving platter, stove top
title: Steamed asparagus with caper crumbs

ingredients.content: 60 g day old sourdough bread, torn into pieces
1 lemon, zest only, no white pith, peeled into strips (1 x 4 cm)
1 tbsp salted capers, rinsed and drained
2 sprigs fresh flat-leaf parsley, leaves only
½ tsp freshly ground black pepper
1 tbsp olive oil, plus extra for garnishing
500 g water, plus extra for cooling

preparations.content: Place bread and lemon zest into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>.
Add capers, almonds, paprika, parsley, mint and pepper and chop <b>6 sec/speed 7<b>.

Place a frying pan (19 cm) over medium-high heat and add butter and olive oil. Transfer crumb mixture into pan and fry, stirring frequently, until golden brown and crunchy (5-10 minutes). Transfer into a bowl and set aside.

Place water into mixing bowl. Place Varoma dish into position and place asparagus into it. Secure Varoma lid and steam <b>10 min/Varoma/speed 1<b>. Transfer asparagus into a bowl filled with cold water to cease cooking. Once cooled, drain and transfer onto paper towel and pat dry.
Place asparagus onto a serving platter and drizzle with olive oil. Scatter generously with crumbs before serving.

hintsAndTricks: Replace almonds with walnuts or pine nuts, if preferred.
If asparagus is not in season, use broccolini instead.
Try adding 50 g speck or bacon to crumb mixture with capers and other crumb ingredients before chopping.
